performances.description: This literally made me tear up. This is why I love Jerry so much. Absolutely beautiful version!
my favorite version, featured on the live album 'go to nassau'
A hot version on Phil's Birthday!

performances.venue: Alpine Valley Music Theatre East Troy, WI
performances.description: Scorcher
How can this song get any hotter? Perfection.

performances.venue: Deer Creek Music Center Noblesville, IN
performances.description: Super hot, super underrated version, akin to the 3/15/90 Without a Net version but with greater energy, flow and interplay (imo).
Perfect groove and massive push from Phil post-lyrics
Slow and steady, with a great Jerry solo.

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York City, NY
performances.description: Lesh and Garcia dominate this one
Absolute scorching late version! Jerry's got swagger in this one.

performances.venue: Rec Hall, Penn State U State College, PA
performances.description: Recent Road Trips release is a perfecto: Outstanding vocals from Jerry and a jam after the lyrics that grooves and rocks super-hard. 5-star version!
Jerry crushes this
Incredible performance by Jerry and Bob and Phil are on fire after the 7 minute mark.
Extremely noisy and loud!

performances.venue: Alpine Valley Music Theatre East Troy, WI
performances.description: Jerry's on and so is Phil.
maybe the best version with bruce

performances.venue: Alligator Alley Gym, University of Florida Gainsville, FL
performances.description: Oh Yea!!!!!!! Just listen to it.

performances.venue: Barton Hall - Cornell University Ithaca, NY
performances.description: Wonderful, heard it this morning on this day in Grateful Dead history, Confident and powerful version.

performances.venue: Saenger Performing Arts Center New Orleans, LA
performances.description: Incredible. Check out Brent's fills during the epic post-lyrics outro. A must-listen top tier Althea w/bounce, power, & panache!
Just another incredible March 81' Althea

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: A cool version from a great show.
I cant believe this one hasnt made the list, crisp vocals and stellar guitar work, its like jerry is painting the air.

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: I dont give a shit if its 1994 thi MSG run has some amazingly hot moments and this Althea is smoking Bobby and Jerry's guitar are hot.
You're kidding me, right? This isn't here?! It's good!
smoking version, last solo positively wails
Exceptional.  Not my favorite tune, but played so well it doesn't matter.

performances.venue: Downs of Santa Fe Santa Fe, NM
Saratoga Performing Arts Center Saratoga Springs, NY
performances.description: excellent version from a truly killer show.
High octane version during first of 3 excellent shows in Chitown to start the year
The perfect backdrop to this outdoor show.
Usual 1995 vocal miscues, but hot version, nontheless!  Great run!

performances.venue: Sam Boyd Silver Bowl Las Vegas, NV
performances.description: great version in vegas
Scorching version of a typically mellow tune.  Crowd energy is palpable.  Althea with a freight train feel.
10 year reunion of Creamery benefit at The old Renaissance Fairgrounds Veneta, Oregon
Love this song. Could listen to Jerry pick it out all day.

performances.venue: Long Beach Arena Long Beach, CA
performances.description: Perfect pace and groove.  Super hot ending jam starting by blasting the main lick full band full force.  Awesome Jerry licks to complete.
This one's a CLINIC. Lots of sweet bending here...the outro is masterful.
Long, patient, mellow version.
just listen to the crowd after this one--

performances.venue: Veterans' Memorial Coliseum New Haven, CT
performances.description: Sweet and funky
Flat out great rendition - with playful finish that will make you smile.
1981 saw a lot of HOT Althea's this is one of them, excellent Jerry vocals and crisp solos, Brent backing up nicely on the keys and a few P.Lesh-bombs

performances.venue: Henry J. Kaiser Convention Center Oakland, CA
performances.description: Hot upbeat version from an awesome show, excellant sound quality the boys were on that night and so was the sound crew.
A nice early groovin' version.

performances.venue: Autzen Stadium - University of Oregon Eugene, OR
performances.description: Smokin' hot and perfectly versed!
Its all Jerry...If JGB played Althea it would sound like this

performances.venue: Marin County Civic Center San Rafael, CA
performances.description: An almost inexplicable dark undertone envelops this Althea, very cool 84' version
This SPACE is getting HOT!
nice relaxed version, into a chill little red rooster, this whole show rips
JUST WOW - This on the money fine voice and perfect picking - Seriously Heady!

performances.venue: West Virginia University Coliseum Morgantown, WV
performances.description: This one's cherry with the last two minutes completely in the pocket!

performances.venue: Long Beach Arena Long Beach, CA
performances.description: Forceful reading that delivers the goods.
Slow and funky with a lot of note bends like all good Althea's. A real cool mellow pace allows the funk to develop smoothly.

performances.venue: Salt Palace Salt Lake City, UT
performances.description: Ripping version and easily the best i've ever heard. Jerry is playing like a man possessed
You're gonna want a piece of this pure excellence :)
Loose, mellow, and serene
Nailed musically and vocally.  Stellar version!

performances.venue: Cape Cod Coliseum South Yarmouth, MA
performances.description: Excellent version from the second night of a hot cape cod run

performances.venue: Henry J. Kaiser Convention Center Oakland, CA
performances.description: fantastic beauty, this beauty just kicks ass. Jerry nailing it. Underrated gem of a show.

performances.venue: Soldiers & Sailors Memorial Hall Kansas City, KS
performances.description: extremely slow, psychedelic jam; can't believe this one wasn't listed yet!
Sily smooth Althea from Providence. Rich Jerry vocals & of course, chunks o'Phil. This deserves a listen & some votes!
Very crisp, smooth version. Crack open a cold one and tap your toes to this one.
Some of the most fun Weir playing and it was Jerry's 1st show back!!!!!
Jerry Shines
Up-beat version here with cool groove to it.  Jerry is lyrically strong.  He nails the solos.  Definately a heady version!

performances.venue: West Palm Beach Auditorium West Palm Beach, FL
performances.description: Have loved this version for years. Each post verse solo is tasty and the outro rocks. Phis also is heavy on the low B at the end.
Smooth with Jerry roughing us up at the end always nice.
This one's solid with a sweet outro... nobody crowds anyone on this one.
A few minor lyrical differences, crisp and clean the band is really nailing this, tight and very well played. Real CRISPY guitar solos.
Funky and spacey sounding version. brent is stellar as is bobby, and Jerry is  singing with passion and spark.
This one comes together nicely. Passionate Garcia vocals.
With Bruce Hornsby
Althea->Sailor->Saint->Deal what a sick set one ending segment.

performances.venue: Cumberland County Civic Center Portland, ME
performances.description: The magic of Portland, ME. This is the last Althea that really excites me until Bruce joins in. Jerry roars,Phil is present and Weir grinds the gears
Just a great, grooving, bluesy Althea. Everyone right in the pocket. Find the exceptional Miller SBD & enjoy.
Another stellar Spring ‘81 Althea

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: Jerry blows roof off of MSG!! Haven't heard anything better since...
mellow Althea, I think it is among the best versions!

performances.venue: Park West Ski Resort Park City, UT
performances.description: This One Flat Out Delivers - Bobby throws FUZZ Bombs behind Jerry tossing off jags at the end. Cherry!
Listen to this one for Jerry's solo. this is a fantastic version.
Fantastic crisp and popping. Really nailed by Jerry and Brent is fantastic as well.
Sweet version at the greek

performances.venue: Pine Knob Music Theater Clarkston, MI
performances.description: Starts dreamy with JG up in the mic and slinky Phil all over it - then sweet jags just how you want it.

performances.venue: Radio City Music Hall New York, NY
performances.description: Go To Heaven reissue bonus track
The space in the final solo is indeed getting hot.
Great outro
Searing work from both Jerry and Bobby.

performances.venue: St. Paul Civic Center Arena St. Paul, MN
performances.description: Slow and groovy, just right
Jerry sounds somewhat youthful, the drummers are really kickin' it and everything comes together nicely
Tempe! Definitive version

performances.venue: Barton Hall - Cornell University Ithaca, NY
performances.description: Epic show. Almost 3 years exactly to the date of the famous 5/8/77 Cornell show.
Althea on Allston Way....
Gorgeous work from Vince throughout

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: Excellent MSG Althea
Real hot version at the Cap Centre followed by a hot let it grow
Closing solo is money.
2nd set placement - you bethca the rideout is strong.
Guitars clash and clank during it's climatic finish
All around great show and the Althea rips like the rest of murder's row from '80

performances.venue: San Diego Sports Arena San Diego, CA
performances.description: 3 versions on archive. Grab the SBD seeded by Brian Cole. Listen to the insane end jam. Listen to the whole thing. This is an A+++ version!
Stunned this ain't here yet. Next night is a famous one. But this 2nd set opener is strong and rugged. Nice moment at "born to be a bachelor..."

performances.venue: Silva Hall - Hult Center for the Performing Arts Eugene, OR
performances.description: Brent stands out, and nobody else is far behind in this one...Jerry seems unusually focused for the era

performances.venue: San Francisco Civic Center San Francisco, CA
performances.description: sweet
Worth a listen to the first Althea on the historic night of Tiger's premiere.
Very nice late era version.  I usually prefer late 1970's early 80's versions but this is killer.

performances.venue: Montego Bay Freeport Zone Montego Bay, JM
performances.description: PHIL LESH BOMBS Abound, Crisp Funky Jerry solos, hot Althea.

performances.venue: Alpine Valley Music Theater East Troy, WI
performances.description: Jerry and Bobby's guitars sound so damn awesome and Brent's keys are kicking ass.
excellent mid 80s Althea,excellent ripping solo
Jerry messes up the lyrics but makes up for it in big ways during the solo. Someone, I wanna say Phil is using this really cool effect. Check it
Inspired rendition with clear strokes JG's genius.
Easy to Love You-> Althea->Lost Sailor-> Saint of Circumstance.
Heavy sounding version well worth its set two position on this beautiful evening

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: Bobby is doing some real cool things nicely sung by Jerry with his later voice and some glistening guitar along with Phil bombing throughout the tune
Official release date of Go to Heaven - Jer works this one out nicely.
how was this not here it is HOT!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Tight, soild version! Surprised this didn't make the list yet.
Tell me there's a better last solo. Liar!

performances.venue: Folsom Field, University of Colorado Boulder,
performances.description: The boys light it up on this classic era Althea. Find an AUD version, this whole show slaps

performances.venue: Radio City Music Hall New York, NY
performances.description: Slow and co speed with Jerry's chops
Surprised this ain't here. Builds nicely.
“You may be the fate of Ophelia.” Don’t sleep on this. Early 80s need more love!
Eighty fuckin’ nine. Hot hot heat!
Super AUD recording of this. There are some great early Althea’s out there, and I was surprised to not see this one already listed.
Chord-tastic solo from Jerry

performances.venue: Sam Boyd Silver Bowl Las Vegas, NV
performances.description: this space is getting hot (like 130 degrees that day in vegas)
A cool version from a great show.

performances.venue: Greek Theatre, U. Of California Berkeley, CA
performances.description: Glacial tempo allows the inherent beauty of the song to come through, and allows Garcia greater flexibility in his leads.
Jerry's into it, Bruce is pushin it along, I dig it.

performances.venue: Santa Fe Downs Santa Fe, NM

performances.description: Magnificent reading of the classic Althea.
Excellent Late era Althea. Jerry could deliver on this tune anytime they played it hot versions in all eras

performances.venue: Brendan Byrne Arena East Rutherford, NJ
performances.description: real nice mid 80's Althea nice work by everyone.
Nice instrumental sections between verses, good first set.
Solid, crisp version.  Great soundboard.
Solid for 1990.
Perfect tone, swells, and peaks.  This soars
Surprised this wasn’t mentioned. Anyone else think Jerry sounds like an angel when he sings “Ophelia?” on this?
Eggselent Althea! Jerry's leads are spine piercing - They grab you and punch you right in the box...
Like all good Altheas, will grab ya.
Mellow smooth, underrated Brent-era show

performances.venue: Community War Memorial Auditorium Rochester, NY
performances.description: A nice little gem where the band is locked in and Jerry is in the zone. The final jam really shines
The band is on point, even bob's slide playing is good.

performances.venue: Alpine Valley Music Theater East Troy, WI
performances.description: A 1980 Althea! Gorgeous and soaring and lilting!

performances.venue: Radio City Music Hall New York, NY
performances.description: Mellow, nice version
major headly

performances.venue: Cumberland County Civic Center Portland, ME
performances.description: Smooth and soothing sweet tones and hits the high peaks nicely. Outro is well jammed.

performances.venue: Greek Theatre - University of California Berkeley, CA
performances.description: Catches a real nice funky groove with some spacey shit going on in the background, really cool interesting version. HOT!
Hot late era version, Vince is  kicking ass here and Jerry is ON!
Excellent vince era althea
Hot Jerry sounds lke an Angel beautiful version.
Hot one to open set 3 Bobbyis very high in the mix on this version. Nice and funky.

performances.venue: Golden Hall, Community Concourse San Diego, CA
performances.description: Smoldering, sultry, perfection. Great solos from Jerry that are just slinky goodness. Certainly worth a listen or two or ten
Well i certainly wasnt their, i was 6 days old 19 miles up the road , got n my soul early, jerry so sassy @ outro! Newbie loves all
Bruce is there to save the day!
The ending rages harder than any '80 Althea. Quality aud with great Jack Straw to follow to end set 1
Jerry starts it off by flubbing the lyrics, but it's well played after that.

performances.venue: Recreation Hall - University of California Davis, CA
performances.description: Epic solo last verse I was on a bus going to JGB  Arcata listening to this show the driver said if I don't turn it down you're off the bus
Smooth
Brooding, hypnotizing version. Beautiful playing by Jerry and Brent, and brilliant vocal with unexpected touches.
Down and dirty.
Delicate & KickShaw
This space gets hot indeed!
Sweet and simple, from a real nice 3 set New Years show!
Jerry sounds so sweet and clear on this.  Makes my heart stop.  Sweeter than Sugar.

performances.venue: Buckeye Lake Music Center Hebron, OH
performances.description: I love speedy 90's altheas!!!! Lots of chaw and twinkly starfall.

performances.venue: Oakland-Alameda County Coliseum Stadium Oakland, CA
performances.description: Phil;s in the pocket and Jerry's short but sweet second solo pew pews into the cosmos. Nice one.
Another great ‘81 Althea, this is where the show starts to pick up

performances.venue: Henry J Kaiser Convention Center Oakland, CA

performances.description: 12/6/92 was the date. Why is this not submitted? Did I miss it? A must listen from an amzing 1st set.
Jerry sings, "when the smoke has cleared she said" twice, but that's the only thing that holds this back from being all timer. Pure early 80s energy!
Worth a listen

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York City, NY
performances.description: Hot! Really builds well. Jerry pickin’ & Bobby making it sleazy with the slide.
Good stuff all around
Fell through the cracks
This show has a little bit of everything
The fact that this isn't already on here continues to attest to how underheard these London shows are.   Smoldering version.
Perfect tempo, and Jerry is on his game
Forceful and confident, with rowdy playing from Bobby and Brent in particular.
Sung with power. Very soulful version
Worth a listen
Hot Althea on a sweltering DC day
The band was really "on" this night. Vince is great here as well. Strong '95 Althea from the boys! Great '95 show too!

performances.venue: Saenger Performing Arts Center New Orleans, LA
performances.description: Damn!
All about Jerry’s expressive singing here
inspired, pouncy. They skip rocks with it, drifting on a reed
1981 is chock full of good Altheas, and this is one. A bunch of cool JG riffs - surprised this isn't listed. Solid show.

performances.venue: Sam Boyd Silver Bowl Las Vegas, NV
performances.description: Vocals are kinda low in the mix, but still a great performance!
Pocket-groovin’ version, (as opposed to stratospheric). Stunned I’m posting this one…
Jerry nails this one. Great later version!
Beautiful version from the Dream Team

performances.venue: Veterans' Memorial Coliseum New Haven, CT
performances.description: Sharp sweet slinky and powerful even blows a fuse at the top c’mon!
